metadata.Title: CVE-2016-9179 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - low.
metadata.Description:
lynx: It was found that Lynx doesn't parse the authority component of the URL correctly when the host name part ends with '?', and could instead be tricked into connecting to a different host. It was discovered that Lynx incorrectly handled certain URLs. A remote attacker could possibly use this issue to connect to a different host.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-9179` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

lynx - 2.8.9dev8-4ubuntu1+esm1
lynx-common - 2.8.9dev8-4ubuntu1+esm1
lynx-cur - 2.8.9dev8-4ubuntu1+esm1
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

notes.Note: ratliff> note that the URL must end in / or the attack won't work

criterions.comment: lynx package in esm-apps/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.8.9dev8-4ubuntu1+esm1').
